p: The largest barrier to eradication of the epidemic is lack of access to care, including diagnostic services and ART costs or prescriptions. A lack in access to care could create pockets of undiagnosed individuals while the overall trend appears to be a reduction in the size of the epidemic [ 23]. Various studies report between 50–96% of diagnosed individuals in the U.S. rely on public medical care to obtain their ART medications [ 10, 20, 24– 26]. Access to care remains critical, but this has not been considered when modeling the dynamics of the epidemic [ 5, 6].
